chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
items.plainText: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

items.text: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
items.plainText: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

items.text: I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.
items.plainText: I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.

items.text: Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.
items.plainText: Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.

items.text: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
items.plainText: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

items.text: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.
items.plainText: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.

items.text: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.
items.plainText: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.

items.text: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
items.plainText: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

items.text: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
items.plainText: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

items.text: Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?
items.plainText: Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?

items.text: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.
items.plainText: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.

items.text: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Ammi-nadib.
items.plainText: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Ammi-nadib.

items.text: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
items.plainText: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
